item.title: [Glitch] Blue Screen
item.dc:creator: lexa2
item.description:
It seems to be post-processing shader problem with some older GPUs.
People who experience this problem - could you please try the proposed workarounds available here:
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?p=502093#post502093

Report back to that thread if the workaround works for you or not. Thanks.

item.title: [Glitch] Blue Screen
item.dc:creator: waveform
item.description:
Hello, everyone.

Yesterday I’ve got the same problem with switching to the “Blue screen” near toxic lakes. And I’ve found solution that works for me.

I turned on HDR in the advanced video options. And picture had come back to normal, and become more shiny and beautiful that it was. And perfomance had not decreased.

So I decide not to turn off HDR any more.

I hope it will help all of you.

item.title: [Glitch] Blue Screen
item.dc:creator: megatrash
item.description:
You could use a workaround: right click Black Mesa in your Steam Library, then select “Properties”, click “Set Launch Options” and then type the following “-dxlevel 80”. Launching game in this mode will result in some glitches, missing textures, etc, but at least you will be able to finish your level. Then you could continue playing in the normal DX9 mode. Thanks to billiam here – https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showpost.php?p=496616&postcount=18
